intro: Haenelia capensis, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Haenelia capensis thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates.
